protocol_name: The draft genome sequence of a desert tree Populus pruinosa
protocol_name_html: The draft genome sequence of a desert tree Populus pruinosa

components.data: Filter the input raw sequences by using the Lighter
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Filter the input raw sequences by using the Lighter

components.data: Filter the input raw sequences by using the 01.QualityControlAndMergeReads.pl script we wrote
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Filter the input raw sequences by using the 01.QualityControlAndMergeReads.pl script we wrote

components.data: Filter the input raw sequences by using the Fastuniq
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Filter the input raw sequences by using the Fastuniq
Run Platanus (version 1.2.1 ) to assemble our genome.

source_data.name: Platanus Assembler (PLATform for Assembling NUcleotide Sequences

platanus assemble -f xx.1.fq xx.2.fq ... -t 50 -m 290 -o Ppr
platanus scaffold -o Ppr -c Ppr_contig.fa -b Ppr_contigBubble.fa -t 64 -IP1 158bp.1.fq 158bp.2.fq -IP2 483bp.1.fq 483bp.2.fq -IP3 780bp.1.fq 780bp.2.fq -OP4 2k.1.fq 2k.2.fq -OP5 5k.1.fq 5k.2.fq -OP6 ...
platanus gap_close -c Ppr_scaffold.fa -o platanus_gapclose -t 64 -IP1 158bp.1.fq 158bp.2.fq -IP2 483bp.1.fq 483bp.2.fq -IP3 780bp.1.fq 780bp.2.fq -OP4 2k.1.fq 2k.2.fq -OP5 5k.1.fq 5k.2.fq -OP6 ...

components.data: Estimate the genome size with k-mer analysis.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Estimate the genome size with k-mer analysis.

components.data: Perform Gapcloser (version 1.12) to further close gaps in our genome obtained in step3.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Perform Gapcloser (version 1.12) to further close gaps in our genome obtained in step3.

components.data: We first examined the coverage of highly conserved genes using BUSCO to evaluate the completeness of our assembly
components.name: Description

source_data.description: We first examined the coverage of highly conserved genes using BUSCO to evaluate the completeness of our assembly

components.data: the unigenes obtained in our study and the protein-coding genes predicted in the P. euphratica and P. trichocarpa genomes were aligned to our genome assembly using the BLAT algorithm with default parameters
components.name: Description

source_data.description: the unigenes obtained in our study and the protein-coding genes predicted in the P. euphratica and P. trichocarpa genomes were aligned to our genome assembly using the BLAT algorithm with default parameters

components.data: we applied the FRC v1.3.0 (Feature-Response Curves) method to evaluate the trade-off between the contiguity and correctness of our assembly.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: we applied the FRC v1.3.0 (Feature-Response Curves) method to evaluate the trade-off between the contiguity and correctness of our assembly.

components.data: We mapped the clean reads from the paired-end libraries to the P. pruinosa genome using the Burrows-Wheeler Aligner (BWA) and performed variant calling using the Genome Analysis Toolkit(GATK).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: We mapped the clean reads from the paired-end libraries to the P. pruinosa genome using the Burrows-Wheeler Aligner (BWA) and performed variant calling using the Genome Analysis Toolkit(GATK).

source_data.name: bwa mem -t 12 -R '@RG ID:<sample id>  SM:<sample id>  LB:<sample id>' Ppr_genome.fa lib1.1.fq.gz lib1.2.fq.gz | samtools sort -O bam -T ./ -l 3 -o <sample id>.bam - samtools rmdup <sample id>.bam <sample id>.rmdup.bam

java -Xmx10g -jar GenomeAnalysisTK.jar -R Ppr_genome.fa -T RealignerTargetCreator -o <sample id>.intervals -I <sample id>.rmdup.bam
java -Xmx10g -jar GenomeAnalysisTK.jar -R Ppr_genome.fa -T IndelRealigner -targetIntervals <sample id>.intervals -o <sample id>.realn.bam -I <sample id>.rmdup.bam

components.data: Run RepeatMasker and RepeatProteinMask (version 4.0.6) to identify repeats in the genome at DNA and protein level, respectively, by aligning sequences against existing databases, Repbase TE library and TE protein database.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Run RepeatMasker and RepeatProteinMask (version 4.0.6) to identify repeats in the genome at DNA and protein level, respectively, by aligning sequences against existing databases, Repbase TE library and TE protein database.

components.data: we annotated tandem repeats using the software Tandem Repeat Finder (TRF v4.07b)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: we annotated tandem repeats using the software Tandem Repeat Finder (TRF v4.07b)

components.data: Run RepeatModeler, and RepeatScout, respectively, to build de novo library based on the input assembled genome sequence.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Run RepeatModeler, and RepeatScout, respectively, to build de novo library based on the input assembled genome sequence.

components.data: Download protein sequences of homlog species (P. euphratica , P. trichocarpa, Ricinus communis, Arabidopsis thaliana, Carica papaya and Eucalyptus grandis), then align these against our masked genome sequences with BLAST, and then using BLAST2GENE to obtain the position informations of the BLAST mapping results, run GeneWise (version 2.4.1 ) to predict genes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Download protein sequences of homlog species (P. euphratica , P. trichocarpa, Ricinus communis, Arabidopsis thaliana, Carica papaya and Eucalyptus grandis), then align these against our masked genome sequences with BLAST, and then using BLAST2GENE to obtain the position informations of the BLAST mapping results, run GeneWise (version 2.4.1 ) to predict genes.

source_data.name:
blast.parse.pl protein2query.out > protein2query.bp
blast2gene.pl protein2query.bp > protein2query.bl2g

components.data: Run Augustus (version 3.2.1) and GenScan to de novo predict genes in the repeat-masked genome sequences.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Run Augustus (version 3.2.1) and GenScan to de novo predict genes in the repeat-masked genome sequences.

components.data: For transcriptome-based approach, the P. pruinosa transcripts obtained above were aligned to the P. pruinosa genome and further assembled using the Program to Assemble Spliced Alignments (PASA v2.0.2) to detect likely protein coding regions.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: For transcriptome-based approach, the P. pruinosa transcripts obtained above were aligned to the P. pruinosa genome and further assembled using the Program to Assemble Spliced Alignments (PASA v2.0.2) to detect likely protein coding regions.

components.data: we integrate genes predicted in step 17-19 to obtain the consensus gene set by using EVM v1.1.1.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: we integrate genes predicted in step 17-19 to obtain the consensus gene set by using EVM v1.1.1.

source_data.name: evidence_modeler.pl --genome <chr name>.fa --weights weights.txt --gene_predictions ab_initio.gff --protein_alignments homolog.gff --transcript_alignments pasa.gff > evm.out; EVM_to_GFF3.pl evm.out <chr name> > evm.out.gff

components.data: we assembled these RNA-seq reads using Trinity
components.name: Description

source_data.description: we assembled these RNA-seq reads using Trinity

source_data.name: Trinity --seqType fq --max_memory 200G --left reads.1.fq.gz --right reads.2.filter.fq.gz --SS_lib_type RF --CPU 30 --no_cleanup --trimmomatic --output <out dir>

components.data: we reduced the redundancy of transcript sequences (>95% similarity) using CD-Hit v4.6.1 next spet 11.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: we reduced the redundancy of transcript sequences (>95% similarity) using CD-Hit v4.6.1 next spet 11.

components.data: we use the software TransDecoder v2.1.0 to identify candidate coding regions within the transcript sequences we filtered at step 12.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: we use the software TransDecoder v2.1.0 to identify candidate coding regions within the transcript sequences we filtered at step 12.

components.data: Determine the blocks syntenic between P. pruinosa and P. euphratica by the software MCScanX.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Determine the blocks syntenic between P. pruinosa and P. euphratica by the software MCScanX.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 1 of The draft genome sequence of a desert tree Populus pruinosa
source_data.protocol_name: The draft genome sequence of a desert tree Populus pruinosa
source_data.protocol_name_html: The draft genome sequence of a desert tree Populus pruinosa
source_data.annotation:
1.using default parameters, which at least five genes were required to call synteny.

2.put the blast result and gff files into the same directory.
source_data.thread_text:
1.using default parameters, which at least five genes were required to call synteny.

2.put the blast result and gff files into the same directory.
source_data.body:
1.using default parameters, which at least five genes were required to call synteny.

2.put the blast result and gff files into the same directory.

components.data: process the whole-genome alignment using the program ‘LAST’.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: process the whole-genome alignment using the program ‘LAST’.

source_data.name:
lastdb -uNEAR -cR11 ref_db ref.fa
lastal -P48 -m100 -E 0.05 ref_db Ppr_genome.fa | last-split > query2db.maf
maf-swap query2db.maf | last-split > query2db.maf.sing.maf

components.data: Align the single-copy gene families identified in the orthomcl result with MUSCLE v3.8.31 and low quality regions of the alignments were identified and trimmed with Gblocks v0.91b using default parameters. Finally, concatenate these Gblocks results into one ‘super gene’ for each species to construct a phylogenetic tree using RAxML v8.2.8.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Align the single-copy gene families identified in the orthomcl result with MUSCLE v3.8.31 and low quality regions of the alignments were identified and trimmed with Gblocks v0.91b using default parameters. Finally, concatenate these Gblocks results into one ‘super gene’ for each species to construct a phylogenetic tree using RAxML v8.2.8.

source_data.name:
clustalw2 -INFILE=align.part.fa -CONVERT -OUTFILE=alian.part.phy -OUTPUT=PHYLIP
raxmlHPC-PTHREADS-AVX -T 30 -f a -x 12345 -p 12345 -# 100 -m GTRGAMMA -s align.part.phy -n tre

components.data: Cluster the gene family using OrthoMCL v3.1 on all the protein-coding genes of P. pruinosa and 10 additional species (P. euphratica, P. trichocarpa, Salix suchowensis, Ricinus communis, Arabidopsis thaliana, Carica papaya, Fragaria vesca, Cucumis sativus, Eucalyptus Grandis and Vitis vinifera).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cluster the gene family using OrthoMCL v3.1 on all the protein-coding genes of P. pruinosa and 10 additional species (P. euphratica, P. trichocarpa, Salix suchowensis, Ricinus communis, Arabidopsis thaliana, Carica papaya, Fragaria vesca, Cucumis sativus, Eucalyptus Grandis and Vitis vinifera).

source_data.name:
orthomclInstallSchema orthomcl.config.template
orthomclAdjustFasta compliantFasta/species species.pep 1
orthomclFilterFasta compliantFasta/ 10 20
makeblastdb -in goodProteins.fasta -dbtype prot
blastp -db goodProteins.fasta -query goodProteins.fasta -out all-all.blastp.out -evalue 1e-5 -outfmt 6 -num_threads 24
orthomclBlastParser all-all.blastp.out compliantFasta > similarSequences.txt
orthomclLoadBlast orthomcl.config.template similarSequences.txt
orthomclPairs orthomcl.config.template orthomcl_pairs.log cleanup=no
orthomclDumpPairsFiles orthomcl.config.template
mcl mclInput --abc -I 1.5 -o mclOutput
orthomclMclToGroups cluster 1 < mclOutput > groups.txt

components.data: examine gene family evolution across entire genomes using the CAFÉ (Computational Analysis of gene Family Evolution, v3.1).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: examine gene family evolution across entire genomes using the CAFÉ (Computational Analysis of gene Family Evolution, v3.1).

source_data.name: CAFÉ (Computational Analysis of gene Family Evolution)

components.data: Estimate the divergence time based on the phylogenetic relationships by the software of MCMCTree, using fossil calibration times for divergence between A. thaliana and C. papaya (54-90 million years ago, Mya), A. thaliana and R. communis (95-109 Mya), V. vinifera and A. thaliana (106-119 Mya), which were obtained from the TimeTree database (http://www.timetree.org/).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Estimate the divergence time based on the phylogenetic relationships by the software of MCMCTree, using fossil calibration times for divergence between A. thaliana and C. papaya (54-90 million years ago, Mya), A. thaliana and R. communis (95-109 Mya), V. vinifera and A. thaliana (106-119 Mya), which were obtained from the TimeTree database (http://www.timetree.org/).

components.data: we align the transcriptome reads we obtained from three tissues to the genome assemly using tophat v2.1.1 and then compute the expression of each gene we predicited using cufflinks v2.2.1
components.name: Description

source_data.description: we align the transcriptome reads we obtained from three tissues to the genome assemly using tophat v2.1.1 and then compute the expression of each gene we predicited using cufflinks v2.2.1

components.data: Cluster the gene family using OrthoMCL v2.0.9 on all the protein-coding genes of P. pruinosa and 10 additional species (P. euphratica, P. trichocarpa, Salix suchowensis, Ricinus communis, Arabidopsis thaliana, Carica papaya,Fragaria vesca, Cucumis sativus, Eucalyptus Grandis and Vitis vinifera).

source_data.name:
orthomclInstallSchema orthomcl.config.template
orthomclAdjustFasta compliantFasta/species species.pep 1
orthomclFilterFasta compliantFasta/ 10 20
makeblastdb -in goodProteins.fasta -dbtype prot
blastp -db goodProteins.fasta -query goodProteins.fasta -out all-all.blastp.out -evalue 1e-5 -outfmt 6 -num_threads 24
orthomclBlastParser all-all.blastp.out compliantFasta > similarSequences.txt
orthomclLoadBlast orthomcl.config.template similarSequences.txt
orthomclPairs orthomcl.config.template orthomcl_pairs.log cleanup=no
orthomclDumpPairsFiles orthomcl.config.template
mcl mclInput --abc -I 1.5 -o mclOutput
orthomclMclToGroups cluster 1 < mclOutput > groups.txt

Finally, concatenate these Gblocks results into one ‘super gene’ for each species to construct a phylogenetic tree using RAxML v8.2.8.
